name: hlop

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cops), wcel(c0, col))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ HL, c0 ∈ OP, c0 ∈ OL)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cops))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, col))
-| wi(wcel(c0, col), wcel(c0, cops))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OP)
⊣ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OL)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OL → c0 ∈ OP)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cops))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, col))
-| wi(wcel(c0, col), wcel(c0, cops))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OP)
⊣ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OL)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OL → c0 ∈ OP)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cops))
-| wi(wcel(c0, col), wcel(c0, cops))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OP)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OL → c0 ∈ OP)

comment: A Hilbert lattice is an orthoposet. (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2011.)
